org.nd4j.base

Class Preconditions

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.nd4j.base.Preconditions

  • public class Preconditions
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility method for method checking arguments.

      • checkArgument

        public static void checkArgument(boolean b)
        Check the specified boolean argument. Throws an IllegalArgumentException if b is false
        Parameters:
        b - Argument to check

      • checkArgument

        public static void checkArgument(boolean b,
                                 java.lang.String message)
        Check the specified boolean argument. Throws an IllegalArgumentException with the specified message if b is false
        Parameters:
        b - Argument to check
        message - Message for exception. May be null

      • checkArgument

        public static void checkArgument(boolean b,
                                 java.lang.String message,
                                 java.lang.Object... args)
        Check the specified boolean argument. Throws an IllegalArgumentException with the specified message if b is false. Note that the message may specify argument locations using "%s" - for example, checkArgument(false, "Got %s values, expected %s", 3, "more" would throw an IllegalArgumentException with the message "Got 3 values, expected more"
        Parameters:
        b - Argument to check
        message - Message for exception. May be null.
        args - Arguments to place in message

      • checkState

        public static void checkState(boolean b)

        Parameters:
        b - State to check

      • checkState

        public static void checkState(boolean b,
                              java.lang.String message,
                              java.lang.Object... args)
        Check the specified boolean argument. Throws an IllegalStateException with the specified message if b is false. Note that the message may specify argument locations using "%s" - for example, checkArgument(false, "Got %s values, expected %s", 3, "more" would throw an IllegalStateException with the message "Got 3 values, expected more"
        Parameters:
        b - Argument to check
        message - Message for exception. May be null.
        args - Arguments to place in message

      • checkNotNull

        public static void checkNotNull(java.lang.Object o,
                                java.lang.String message,
                                java.lang.Object... args)
        Check the specified boolean argument. Throws an IllegalStateException with the specified message if o is false. Note that the message may specify argument locations using "%s" - for example, checkArgument(false, "Got %s values, expected %s", 3, "more" would throw an IllegalStateException with the message "Got 3 values, expected more"
        Parameters:
        o - Object to check
        message - Message for exception. May be null.
